lifecycle.sourceOfTruth: audiense zeroheight tabs page (captured) + titan token contract
lifecycle.usageRule: Implement Tabs from source contract first. If docs/rules/spec conflict, source-of-truth wins.
lifecycle.migrationTrigger: Sync local docs/rules/spec whenever tabs source updates.

tabs.description: Tabs organize related content into sections and switch visible panel in-place.

canonicalTerminology.rule: Use canonical names in docs/rules/contracts; do not use aliases.

structure.selectionRule: Exactly one tab selected per tablist.

interaction.keyboard: Arrow keys move focus between tabs; Enter/Space activates selected tab.
interaction.panelBehavior: Only active tab panel is visible; inactive panels are hidden from view.

responsive.overflowRule: When tabs overflow width, enable horizontal scrolling or controlled collapse without breaking selection.
responsive.labelRule: Keep labels concise and readable; avoid wrapping when possible.

do: Use Tabs for sibling content sections in same context.
Preserve selected tab state on re-render when possible.
dont: Do not use Tabs as primary global navigation.
Do not hide critical actions behind disabled tabs without explanation.
Do not allow multiple selected tabs in a single tablist.

blockingRules: If required tab semantics cannot be satisfied, return BLOCKER.
If required states are missing, return FAIL.
If selection behavior allows more than one active tab, return FAIL.
reviewScenarios: Render tab list with visible default/hover/selected/disabled states.
Demonstrate keyboard arrows + Enter/Space selection behavior.
Demonstrate panel switching with only one visible active panel.
Demonstrate overflow behavior with horizontal scroll or controlled collapse.
a11yAcceptance: Tablist exposes proper semantics and labels.
Each tab is associated with exactly one panel.
Selected tab is announced and disabled tabs are non-activatable.
Focus-visible is present during keyboard traversal.

fail: Missing required visible tab states in review harness.
More than one tab selected in the same tablist.
Disabled tab can still be activated.
blocker: Missing semantic token mappings required for selected or disabled tab states.
